Database¶

Defines tables in landrecords database using SQLAlchemy.

The landrecords database consists of eight tables, four of which come from the raw HTML data (details, vendors, vendees and locations). neighborhoods comes from the city’s shapefile on data.nola.gov. dashboard is a private admin dashboard. spatial_ref_sys is part of the PostGIS extension. The cleaned and crunched data in the original four tables feed into the cleaned table, which is the only public-facing table.

class landrecords.db.Cleaned(geom, amount, document_date, document_recorded, address, location_info, sellers, buyers, instrument_no, latitude, longitude, zip_code, detail_publish, location_publish, assessor_publish, permanent_flag, neighborhood)[source]¶

Fields for the cleaned table.

Parameters:
  • instrument_no – String. Primary key ID.
  • amount – BigInteger. The sale amount.
  • document_date – Date. The date the property was sold.
  • document_recorded – Date. The date the property sale was recorded.
  • address – String. The full address of the property, including the street number and the address. Ex. 123 Main St.
  • location_info – String. All of the extra location information, such as the lot, unit, condo, etc.
  • sellers – String. The person, people or companies that sold the property, AKA the “vendors.”
  • buyers – String. The person, people or companies that bought the property, AKA the “vendees.”
  • latitude – Float. Determined from geocoding.
  • longitude – Float. Determined from geocoding.
  • rating – String. Determined from geocoding.
  • zip_code – String. Determined from geocoding.
  • neighborhood – String. Determined via PostGIS query between lat/lng and the city’s neighborhood shapefile.
  • detail_publish – Boolean. True allows to publish at all, False does not publish in table or on map. True/False determined by checks in publish.py.
  • location_publish – Boolean. True allows to plot on map, False does not plot on map. True/False determined by checks in publish.py.
  • assessor_publish – Boolean. True allows link to assessor’s website, False does not. True/False determined by checks in check_assessor.py.
  • permanent_flag – Boolean. True denotes permanent status, False denotes temporary status. True/False (permanent/temporary) is determined by the permanent range found during scraping.
  • geom – Geometry (Point). A spatial index for spatial queries.
class landrecords.db.Dashboard(gid, amount, document_date, document_recorded, address, location_info, sellers, buyers, instrument_no, latitude, longitude, zip_code, detail_publish, location_publish, neighborhood, fixed)[source]¶

Dashboard table, only for private admin use.

class landrecords.db.Detail(document_id, document_type, instrument_no, multi_seq, min_, cin, book_type, book, page, document_date, document_recorded, amount, status, prior_mortgage_doc_type, prior_conveyance_doc_type, cancel_status, remarks, no_pages_in_image, image, detail_publish, permanent_flag)[source]¶

Fields for the details table.

Parameters:
  • document_id – String. Primary key ID.
  • document_type – String. The type of document on the Land Records Division’s website. Ex. Sale, marriage certificate, lien, etc.
  • instrument_no – String. The unique identifier in the Land Records Division’s records.
  • multi_seq – String. Not used.
  • min – String. Not used. Uses “min_” instead of “min” because “min” is a reserved word in Python.
  • cin – String. Not used.
  • book_type – String. Not used.
  • page – String. Not used.
  • document_date – Date. The date when the sale was made.
  • document_recorded – Date. The date when the sale was recorded.
  • amount – BigInteger. The sale amount.
  • status – String. The status of the indexing process. Ex. Verified, Entered. Refers to the status of the permanent-temporary process.
  • prior_mortgage_doc_type – String. Not used.
  • prior_conveyance_doc_type – String. Not used.
  • cancel_status – String. Not used.
  • remarks – String. Not used.
  • no_pages_in_image – String. The number of images. Not used.
  • image – String. A link to the image. Not used.
  • detail_publish – Boolean. True means this sale is okay to publish, False means it is not okay to publish. True/False is determined by checks in publish.py.
  • permanent_flag – Boolean. True means this sale’s information is permanent, False means it is still temporary. True/False is determined by checks during scraping process.
class landrecords.db.Location(gid, subdivision, condo, district, square, lot, cancel_status_lot, street_number, address, unit, weeks, cancel_status_unit, freeform_legal, document_id, latitude, longitude, rating, zip_code, neighborhood, location_publish)[source]¶

Fields for the locations table.

Parameters:
  • gid – Integer. Primary key ID
  • document_id – String. The unique ID on the Land Records Division’s website.
  • street_number – String. Street number. Ex. ‘123’, for 123 MAIN ST.
  • address – String. The street name and type. Ex. ‘MAIN ST’, for 123 MAIN ST.
  • district – String. The municipal district.
  • square – String. The property’s square (block) in the assessor’s database.
  • lot – String. The property’s lot number in the assessor’s database.
  • unit – String. The individual unit(s) within a particular lot.
  • subdivision – String. The subdivision of the property.
  • condo – String. The condominium the property is a part of.
  • weeks – String. The number of weeks per year the property was sold for.
  • cancel_status_lot – String. The cancel status of the lot (first in locations table).
  • cancel_status_unit – String. The cancel status of the unit (second in locations table).
  • freeform_legal – String. Last field in locations table.
  • latitude – Float. Not part of raw data. Determined via geocoding.
  • longitude – Float. Not part of raw data. Determined via geocoding.
  • rating – String. Not part of raw data. Determined via geocoding.
  • zip_code – String. Not part of raw data. Determined via geocoding.
  • neighborhood – String. Not part of raw data. Determined via PostGIS query between lat/lng and the city’s neighborhood shapefile.
  • location_publish – Boolean. True allows to plot on map, False does not plot on map. True/False determined by checks in publish.py.
class landrecords.db.Neighborhood(gid, objectid, gnocdc_lab, lup_lab, neigh_id, shape_leng, shape_area, geom)[source]¶

Fields for the neighborhoods table.

Parameters:
  • gid – Integer. Primary key ID.
  • objectid – Integer. Not sure
  • gnocdc_lab – String. Not sure.
  • lup_lab – String. Not sure.
  • neigh_id – String. Not sure.
  • shape_leng – Numeric. The (perimeter?) of the neighborhood (units?).
  • shape_area – Numeric. The area of the neighborhood (units?).
  • geom – Geometry(Multipolygon). The PostGIS geometry of the neighborhood.
class landrecords.db.Vendee(gid, document_id, vendee_blank, vendee_p_c, vendee_lastname, vendee_firstname, vendee_relator, vendee_cancel_status)[source]¶

Fields for the vendees table.

Parameters:
  • gid – Integer. Primary key ID.
  • document_id – String. The unique identifier on the Land Records Division’s website.
  • vendee_blank – String. Not used.
  • vendee_p_c – String. Not used.
  • vendee_lastname – String. The last name of the vendee.
  • vendee_firstname – String. The first name of the vendee.
  • vendee_relator – String. Can’t remember right now.
  • vendee_cancel_status – String. Not used.
class landrecords.db.Vendor(gid, document_id, vendor_blank, vendor_p_c, vendor_lastname, vendor_firstname, vendor_relator, vendor_cancel_status)[source]¶

Fields for the vendors table.

Parameters:
  • gid – Integer. Primary key ID.
  • document_id – String. The unique identifier on the Land Records Division’s website.
  • vendor_blank – String. Not used.
  • vendor_p_c – String. Not used.
  • vendor_lastname – String. The last name of the vendor.
  • vendor_firstname – String. The first name of the vendor.
  • vendor_relator – String. Can’t remember right now.
  • vendor_cancel_status – String. Not used.
